column4: Would this be the place to ask how to mount a CD drive so I can burn my ubunu image?
(And yes, I'm new to linux.  About 72 hours new)
which OS are you trying to burn in?
I'm in another distro of linux (cAos)
GNOME is my specific GUI as of now.
Nautilus can burn ISOs in Gnome - find your ISO file, right click, select "Burn To Disc"
First off, I need to mount the disc.
And I've got GnomeBaker, so I can burn just fine.
I need to mount the drive more than anything else.
your burner doesn't automount when you put a CD in it?
Nope.  Perhaps a problem then?  Lemmie see if I can get an error readout from somewhere.
how would I manually mount the drive?
I've never had to do that (yet), so I"m not at all sure. Try reading "man mount" in a terminal
I've mounted harddrives, but not optical drives, so I'm not sure if they're mounted the same way
hang around here and ask again later, or check ubuntuforums.org
